oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Speech of Mayor Richard H. Fulton, Austin, Texas, circa 1982
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A typescript of a speech by Nashville Mayor Richard H. Fulton, circa 1982, with a notation "Austin, Texas, May 10. This speech discusses American Federalism and how "from its first dramatic expression in the Federalists Papers, the relations of Federal, State, and Local governments have been at the heart of many of our greatest constitutional issues." In the speech, Mayor Fulton further states that "although many issues are national in scope, any domestic policy, irrespective of its place of origin, ultimately comes to rest in our cities. As Mayor of Nashville and Chairman of the United States Conference of Mayors Advisory Committee, I am here today to represent that perspective." Forms part of Mayor Richard Fulton Papers, Speeches. 1 typescript
